title: Space Development Agency is now officially part of the Space Force
summary: The Space Development Agency was officially transferred to the U.S. Space Force, Oct. 1.

title: Preps resume for SpaceX crew launch after Hurricane Ian
summary: The multinational crew scheduled to ride a SpaceX rocket into orbit Wednesday arrived at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center Saturday as ground teams rolled their Falcon 9 booster and Dragon Endurance spacecraft to the launch pad, resuming work suspended earlier in the week as Hurricane Ian moved across Florida.

title: Firefly, Millennium Space selected for U.S. Space Force rapid-launch demonstration
summary: The U.S. Space Systems Command announced Sept. 30 it selected Firefly Space Transport Services and Millennium Space Systems to conduct a demonstration of a rapid-response space mission to low Earth orbit in 2023.

title: Firefly’s Alpha rocket reaches orbit on second launch
summary: Firefly Aerospace’s Alpha launch vehicle reached orbit on its second launch Oct. 1, more than a year after the vehicle’s first launch failed.

title: Firefly succeeds on second Alpha flight
summary: With the goal of successfully reaching orbit, Firefly successfully launched FLTA002 – its second demonstration flight of the Alpha launch vehicle – on the mission dubbed “To The Black.” Launching from Space Launch Complex 2 West (SLC-2W) at the Vandenberg Space Force Base in California, the vehicle lifted off at 12:01 AM PDT (07:01 UTC) on Oct. 1.
